title: Tom Kha Gai (Thai Coconut Chicken Soup)

ingredients.name: lemongrass stalk, pounded and cut into 2-inch pieces

steps: Heat coconut oil in a medium pot over medium heat.
Add onion, garlic, jalapeño, galangal, lemongrass, and curry paste. Cook 5 minutes, stirring frequently, until onions soften.
Add chicken broth and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer 30 minutes uncovered.
Add coconut cream, chicken, and mushrooms. Simmer until chicken cooks through.
Season with fish sauce, coconut sugar, and lime juice to taste.
Ladle into bowls and top with green onions and cilantro.
notes: Volume conversions: 1 tbsp coconut oil ≈ 14g, ½ onion ≈ 100g, 2 cloves garlic ≈ 10g, ½ jalapeño ≈ 25g, 3 slices galangal ≈ 15g, 1 lemongrass stalk ≈ 15g, 2 tsp curry paste ≈ 10g, 4 cups broth ≈ 960g, 4 cups coconut cream ≈ 960g
Can substitute 1-3 Thai chiles for jalapeño
Can use coconut milk instead of coconut cream
Whole30, paleo, and vegan adaptations available
